result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew M Lehman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time, but no less than partime employment.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription bearing his name and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.
Maintain an alcohol and Drug free living environment. 
Complete anger management programming.

10:40 a.m. Defendant Andrew M. Lehman in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information was filed today, but plead to on 03-11-15. ADA didn't have in the file at the time of plea hearing and found it today in the file.  PSI report received and reviewed by the Parties only correction is the statute for count 2 was incorrect and corrected by the Amended Information.  Parties are ready to proceed today.  State recommends jointly: 

BY THE COURT:**********PROBATION**********
14CF138: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation 
Conditions:   
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription bearing his name and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time, but no less than partime employment.  
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.
Maintain an alcohol and Drug free living environment. 
Complete anger management programming.
Pay court costs and DNA surcharge.

14CF433 Count 1: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation, concurrent with 14CF138. Same conditions. Pay costs & DNA surcharge.
14CF433 Count 2: WW/H Sentence: 1 yr Probation, concurrent with count 1 and 14CF138. Same conditions. Pay costs & DNA surcharge.
Sentencing hearing at 08-12-2015 10:30 am
from Agent Tatro re: no contact with defendant for PSI
Sentencing hearing at 07-16-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Andrew M Lehman in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 14CF-138 and 14CF-433.

11:33 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Court received a letter from the agent, could not contact Defendant, requested a continuance.

Atty Cousins and Atty Renc received the same letter.

Court questions Defendant.

Defendant addresses the Court, did not get any of the letters or got any of the phone calls.

Agent is present, Agent Tatro.
Court questions Agent.

Agent addresses the Court, gave all the paperwork to Defendant to fill out, and was told to come back in a week. Defendant did not return and Agent could not contact Defendant.

Defendant addresses the Court, did not get the paperwork done, did not think about it. 
Defendant is extremely nervous and freaked out and will return the paperwork.

Court will give Defendant one more chance.  

Matter will be rescheduled.

Agent is to let Court know if Defendant does not cooperate.
If Defendant does not cooperate, Court will order a bench warrant.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on June 2, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Andrew M Lehman in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 
10:10 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  Moves to amend 14CF433 Count 2 to Disorderly Conduct 947.01.  Has not filed an amended information.  
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF138 Count 1 - GUILTY
14CF433 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 14CF138 Count 1 and 14CF433 Counts 1 and 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Court orders a PSI. 
Parties to see the Judicial Assistant for a sentencing hearing date. 

BY THECOURT: 
Dismissed and read-in are 14CF269 and 14CF298.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Atty Renc indicates Count 2 of 14CF269 has previously been dismissed. 
Court notes.
Plea hearing on March 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant Record Update

Pre-trial conference on January 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant ANDREW M LEHMAN in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant ANDREW M LEHMAN in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF138, 14CF269, 14CF298, 11CF325, 14CF433

Atty Constable indicates there is confusion re: the offer.  Atty Renc needs to speak with the defendant further, parties do anticipate a plea still.  Asks the Court to hear the SAR in 11CF325 and the initial appearance in 14CF433 at this time. 
Atty Renc concurs.  Asks that the other cases be set for a pre-trial conference on December 8, 2014. 

14CF433 -   
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Attorney Renc waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Preliminary hearing is set for 12/8/14 at 3:00 p.m. 

(14CF138, 14CF269 and 14CF298 are set for a pre-trial conference on 12/8/14 at 9:00 a.m.)

11CF325 - 
Court and both counsel have received the Revocation summary. 
Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court questions jail credit. 
Atty Renc responds.  
Court reviews WCCA for other county case information. 

BY THE COURT: 
11CF325 -
Serve 270 days in jail, concurrent with the Outagamie County sentence he is currently serving. 
174 days credit. 
Unpaid costs are converted to a civil judgment. 

Atty Constable recommends a signature bond in 14CF433 with conditions as stated. 
Atty Renc makes arguments re: the no contact request.  Asks for no abusive contact.
Pre-trial conference on December 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on November 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Written
Pre-trial conference on August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew M Lehman in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Andrew M Lehman in custody. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

Bond is reinstated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on June 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
